news.title: World leaders are fed food waste, and it's great
news.description: Two chefs prepared a meal made of food waste for dozens of world leaders at an informal working lunch on climate and sustainable development goals at the United Nations Sunday

news.title: Rockefeller foundation to take food-waste fight to Davos
news.description: The Rockefeller Foundation plans to announce that it is kicking off a $130 million initiative to reduce food waste around the world

news.title: Denmark opens first food waste supermarket selling surplus produce
news.description: A charity has opened Denmark's first ever food surplus supermarket

news.title: Zero Percent turns to crowdfunding to prevent food waste
news.description: Zero Percent, a startup that coordinates excess food donations and pickups, is launching a new crowdfunding platform to raise money for nonprofits that canâ€™t afford to pay for the gas or workers it takes to pick up food

news.title: One third of food is lost or wasted: What can be done
news.description: One-third of food produced for human consumption worldwide is annually lost or wasted

news.title: Tossing out food in the trash? In Seattle, you'll be fined for that
news.description: In Seattle, wasting food will earn you a red tag posted on a garbage bin that tells everyone you've violated a new city law that makes it illegal to put food into trash cans

news.title: Best before dates lead to waste by consumers
news.description: Consumers are throwing away thousands of dollars and kilograms of food each year simply because they misunderstand what the best before date actually means

news.title: Recyling the leftovers
news.description: Americans threw away more than 36 million tons of food in 2012, according to the Environmental Protection Agency

news.title: I dumpster-dived with a bunch of freegans
news.description: A reporter investigates the lifestyle of freegans

news.title: Waste not
news.description: Local groups work to reduce, redistribute, and rescue food from loss and landfills
